newsArray.content: Nigerian-born England international, Eberechi Eze is currently battling with a hamstring injury which will keep him out of football for six weeks. The Crystal Palace star sustained the injury in the Premier League game against Manchester United on Saturday, September 30 which ended in a 1-0 win for his team. Recall that during the game, Crystal Palace coach Roy Hodgson had to substitute Eberechi Eze for Chris Richards in the 88th minute but it wasn’t clear then that the Nigerian-born midfielder was battling with an injury. Before the Manchester United game, Eze has always played the entire minutes in all Palace Premier League games this season. With his help, Palace has recorded three wins, two draws, and two defeats which placed them in the 9th spot with 11 points in 7 games. As it stands, Eberechi Eze won’t be available for coach Roy Hodgson when Palace face Nottingham Forest this coming weekend. He will not also be available for the games against Newcastle and Tottenham after the October international break. Eze will use the break to continue with his recuperation, hence, he won’t be available for selection when coach Gareth Southgate assembles his team for England’s friendly game against Australia on October 13. He will not also be available for the Euro 2024 qualifying game against Italy at Wembley Stadium on October 17. Aside from Eberechi Eze, Crystal Palace are currently without 21-year-old winger Michael Olise who is also battling with a recurring hamstring problem.

newsArray.title: PGMOL make controversial Diaz VAR audio public
newsArray.description: The PGMOL releases the audio recordings between the match officials for Liverpool forward Luis Diaz's disallowed goal against Tottenham.
newsArray.content: Match of the Day: Incorrect VAR decision rules out Luis Diaz goal against Tottenham The audio recordings of discussions between the match officials around Luis Diaz's disallowed goal against Tottenham have been made public. Liverpool asked the Premier League for the audio after the controversy in the first half of their 2-1 defeat. Video assistant referee Darren England did not overrule when Liverpool's Diaz was wrongly flagged offside. In the audio, England says the check is "perfect" before swearing when he realises a mistake has been made. Following the incident in Saturday's Premier League game, Liverpool said "sporting integrity has been undermined". In a statement on Sunday, the club said they will "explore the range of options available given the clear need for escalation and resolution". PGMOL, the governing body for referees, has said the decision to disallow the goal was "a significant human error". "In a lapse of concentration and loss of focus in that moment, the VAR lost sight of the on field decision and he incorrectly communicated "check complete", therefore inadvertently confirming the on-field decision," added PGMOL in a statement accompanying the release of the audio on Tuesday. "He did this without any dialogue with the Assistant VAR (AVAR). The match then restarted immediately. "After a few seconds, the Replay Operator and then the AVAR queried the check-complete outcome with the VAR and asked him to review the image that had been created, pointing out that the original on-field decision had been offside, but this was not communicated to the on-field team at any point during the match. "The VAR team then gave consideration as to whether the game could be stopped at that point. "However, the VAR and AVAR concluded that the VAR protocol within the Laws of the Game would not permit that to happen, and they decided intervention was not possible as play had restarted." newsArray.title: Kickoff | Chiefs to feel the pain of another trophy miss
newsArray.description: Kaizer Chiefs will again feel the effects of their frustrating trophy drought this weekend with Orlando Pirates having an opportunity to further close the gap while Mamelodi Sundowns will widen their gap of dominance.
newsArray.content: The latest edition of the MTN8 pits Orlando Pirates against Mamelodi Sundowns. Pirates are aiming to defend the trophy that they won under 12 months ago at the same venue while Sundowns will be out to also wrestle back the title that they also won the previous year (2021). The Bucs and The Brazilians have never met in a final of this competition since MTN took over sponsorship in 2008 with the last time they played in the decider having been when SAA was still the financial backer in 2007. Sundowns won 1-0 on that occasion 16 years ago and considering their dominance of domestic football through the last decade and recent results will be the favourites on Saturday. Should Rulani Mokwena lift the trophy on Saturday it will push Sundowns’ trophy tally in the PSL era years up to 26. It will also mean the Chloorkop based club has now won 16 trophies since Chiefs last tasted silverware eight years ago. Chiefs remain stuck on 20. For Pirates, MTN8 success will bring them ever closer to AmaKhosi. After lifting the MTN8 and Nedbank Cup last season, Pirates have now moved to 15 titles. Of note is the fact that when Chiefs landed trophy number 20 of the PSL era years in 2015, Sundowns only had half of that loot but have now gone on to surpass AmaKhosi and create a gap of five within eight years.

newsArray.content: Former FC Barcelona, Manchester United, and AC Milan talismanic striker, Zlatan Ibrahimovic has confirmed that he turned down an offer from Arsenal as a youngster. Zlatan Ibrahimovic who retired from football earlier this year after an illustrious football career that saw him score a total of 405 League goals for the 9 different clubs he has played for said coach Arsene Wenger invited him to Arsenal but he turned down the invitation. Ibrahimovic who stated this in an interview with Piers Morgan which will be released on Thursday, October 5, said he had to turn down the invitation then because the former Arsenal’s coach was inviting him for a trial. The 42-year-old Swedish football icon stressed that he was too good to go for trials which was why he turned down the offer even though he was just a 17-year-old then. “Wenger invited me but I didn’t go to Arsenal. I don’t do trials”, he said. “No no, you don’t understand… I don’t do trials. I am the best; f**k the rest”. After turning down an opportunity to play for Arsenal, Zlatan Ibrahimovic went on to join Dutch club Ajax in 2001 where he won two Eredivisie, one KNVB Cup, and one Johan Cruyff Shield. From there, he joined Juventus in 2004, Inter Milan in 2006, and FC Barcelona in 2009. While at FC Barcelona, before he went on loan at AC Milan in 2010, he was coached by Pep Guardiola who was just venturing into professional coaching then. In his interview with Piers Morgan, Zlatan Ibrahimovic revealed that one of the rules of Pep Guardiola at Barcelona was that none of his players must drive a luxurious car like a Ferrari to training. Immediately the coach told him that, he brought a Ferrari to training. The Swedish icon said, “When I first met Pep Guardiola, he told me: remember, players here don’t come with Ferraris”. “What did I do? Of course. I brought my f**** Ferrari”.

newsArray.title: Heisman Watch: USC’s Caleb Williams would join select company even if he finishes second
creator: Jon Wilner
newsArray.description: The reigning Heisman Trophy winner would join select company if he repeats the accomplishment or finishes second.
newsArray.content: Caleb Williams is chasing Heisman Trophy history on more than one level. The USC quarterback is attempting to join Ohio State running back Archie Griffin as the only repeat winners. But the list of Heisman honorees who finished second the following year is equally short. It includes Oklahoma running back Billy Sims, who won the Heisman in 1978 and was runner-up to USC’s Charles White in 1979, and nobody else. Even a third-place finish the succeeding year is a high bar for the winners, with just six players accomplishing that feat: SMU running back Doak Walker, BYU quarterback Ty Detmer, Oklahoma quarterback Jason White, USC quarterback Matt Leinart, Florida quarterback Tim Tebow and Louisville quarterback Lamar Jackson. Williams has all the ingredients necessary to return to New York City as a finalist, from the brand power of his school to the video-game statistics he produces each week to the big-stage showdowns looming in the heart of the season. But like so many other winners, Williams is competing against himself — against the standard he set last year and the hype he generated throughout the offseason. Also, he’s competing against USC’s rickety defense, which stands to cost the Trojans a game or two (or three). And if the Trojans are out of the playoff hunt in the stretch run, Williams’ candidacy could suffer. Welcome to our weekly look at the Pac-12’s leading Heisman Trophy candidates via an assessment of the top players in the conference. Consider this one Heisman voter’s view of the landscape. The rankings below are based on individual performance, value to the team and quality of competition. Arizona State WR Elijhah Badger, USC AP Zachariah Branch, Oregon WR Troy Franklin and Colorado WR/CB Travis Hunter. 1. Washington QB Michael Penix Jr. 1 399.8 yards per game, 11.2 yards per attempt, 16 touchdowns Penix’s standard of excellence is so high that throwing for 363 yards in a road win (at Arizona) felt like a subpar performance. He has the platform to potentially take control of the race in two weeks when the Huskies host Oregon. 2. USC QB Caleb Williams 4 217.7 passer rating, 11.4 yards per attempt, 21 touchdowns After Penix duels with Oregon’s Bo Nix on the afternoon of Oct. 14, Williams will take center stage on hallowed ground. USC’s primetime showdown with Notre Dame will determine whether Williams enters the second half of the season as the frontrunner or a contender. 3. Oregon QB Bo Nix 2 184.7 passer rating, 80.4 completion percentage, 15 touchdowns Nix completed 27-of-32 passes for 290 yards and four touchdowns in the victory at Stanford and dropped a spot in our rankings. Such is life in the Pac-12 this season. His chances to ascend are coming, in unrelenting fashion. 4. Washington State QB Cam Ward 3 347.3 yards per game, 74.5 completion percentage, zero interceptions The most recent Heisman odds from BetMGM list 11 players ahead of Ward. Keep everything about his season the same and change the name on his uniform to USC or Texas, and he would be in the lead pack alongside Penix, Williams and Nix. 5. Colorado QB Shedeur Sanders 5 356.2 yards per game, 74.8 completion percentage, 15 touchdowns Sanders was marvelous in the second half against USC and finished with numbers that suggest he should remain on the top tier. But victories are essential to sustained Heisman campaigns. A few more losses, and Sanders’ prospects will plunge. 6. Washington WR Rome Odunze 6 19 yards per catch, 4 touchdowns, 141.8 all-purpose yards per game The best offensive player in the conference who doesn’t play quarterback had a modest evening in the desert with five catches for 64 yards. The margin for receivers is thin. Odunze needs a big game against the Ducks. Related Articles 7. Utah DE Jonah Elliss 7 10.5 tackles-for-loss, 7.5 sacks If the season ended today, Elliss would be our pick for Pac-12 Defensive Player of the Year. The son of former Utah star Luther Elliss leads the country in sacks and is second in tackles-for-loss. At his current rate, he will be a finalist for numerous national defensive awards. 8. Oregon State TB Damien Martinez 10 99.4 yards per game, 6.8 yards per carry The Pac-12’s best tailback managed just 65 yards against Utah’s granite defense but remains on pace for all-conference honors and a 1,000-yard season. As Martinez goes, so go the Beavers — and they hope to go all the way to the conference championship. 9. Cal TB Jaydn Ott Not ranked 117.8 yards per game, 5 touchdowns Ott carved up Arizona State for 165 yards last weekend and is one of the top off-the-radar playmakers in the conference. Cal simply doesn’t participate in enough high-profile games for Ott to gain recognition outside the conference footprint. 10. Washington State Edge Ron Stone Jr. 9 20 tackles, 4 tackles-for-loss, 2 fumbles forced Stone lost early-season momentum due to a drop in production and WSU’s bye. But a major opportunity awaits this week against UCLA’s wobbly offensive line, which surrendered seven sacks to Utah.

newsArray.title: Семак высказался о дебюте Адамова за «Зенит»
newsArray.description: Главный тренер «Зенита» Сергей Семак прокомментировал дебют голкипера Дениса Адамова.
newsArray.content: Главный тренер «Зенита» Сергей Семак прокомментировал дебют голкипера Дениса Адамова. — Родригао вернулся в основной состав. Его возвращение означает, что вы можете переключиться обратно с тройки центральных защитников на двойку или это несвязанные вещи? — Конечно, мы можем, учитывая то количество повреждений, которое было... Еще месяц назад у нас четыре центральных защитника были травмированы. Конечно, он набирает форму. Мы будем смотреть как Марио, как Слава Караваев. Посмотрим на наличие тех или иных игроков и будем отталкиваться при выборе схемы и того, как будем играть. Естественно, будем анализировать соперника и если нужны будут какие-то изменения, будем их вносить — Официально дебютировал Денис Адамов... — У нас в чемпионате играл Миша, получил травму. Сыграл Саша. У нас есть Адамов, которому мы хотели дать игровою практику. Сегодня такая возможность предоставилась, такая же ситуация и на других позициях. Мы по возможности даем играть тем, кто меньше играет в чемпионате. — В перерыве вы сделали тройную замену. Можете рассказать, она запланирована? Или вы недовольны были Ренаном, Коваленко и Изидором? — Думаю, конечно, и Саше, и Изидору не всегда понятно как играть в той или иной ситуации, а игроки, которые у нас дольше времени играют, они больше требования понимают. Что касается Алипа и Ренана, чтобы выпустить игрока, нужен был еще один русский. Потому что у нас в стартовом составе вышли три россиянина — Ваня Сергеев, Саша Коваленко и Денис Адамов. Чтобы поменять Коваленко, нужно было выпустить русского игрока. Дали возможность и Алипу 45 минут сыграть, и Ренану, чтобы все были в тонусе. По поводу Кассьерры, конечно, запланировано, потому что он пропустил из-за микроповреждения. Ему нужно набирать форму и возвращаться в тот ритм, который у него был. По поводу Коваленко и Барриоса —и Барриос нужен, он уже соскучился по Кубку, очень долго не играл. И мы, тем самым, дали ему хорошую возможность быть в тонусе. — Вы сказали, что замена Ренана была связана с лимитом. Но может быть вы видели, выступил его агент, который сказал, что Ренан — не игрок скамейки, что он должен играть. Как-то вы отреагировали на это и что думаете по поводу этих слов? Какие шансы у Ренана вернуться в основной состав полноценно? — Думаю, у Роберта такие же шансы, как и у других игроков вернуться. Для того, чтобы играть в стартовом составе, нужно заслужить и быть лучше. Есть определенная конкуренция. А по поводу слов — зачем что-то комментировать? Я смотрю на то, как ребята выглядят. Ренан очень молодой игрок, естественно ему нужно прибавлять. К сожалению, иногда он достаточно часто ошибается, что свойственно молодежи, и нужно потихоньку его выводить тот уровень, когда он пришел. Эмоционально он был на подъеме. А что касается именно оборонительных действий, он не всегда надежно играет , — сказал Семак на пресс-конференции. «Зенит» (11 очков) вышел на первое место в группе C, обойдя «Балтику» (9 очков). В заключительном туре сине-бело-голубые 31 октября дома сыграют с «Крыльями Советов».

newsArray.content: Uganda Christian University (UCU) registered a 7-1 victory against Busitema University in the University Football League on Tuesday in Mukono. It was a sounding victory to make a statement as UCU ran riot over the Busia based side. Six minutes into the game, the hosts got their first cut through Geoffrey Gagganga but Busitema’s defender Jonathan Aapa made a great interception. UCU skipper Geofrey Gaganga released Isaac Ofoyrwoth on the left flank but failed to go but the lanky defender. Peter Kyomuhendo gave UCU the lead through a tap-in to light up the party at home. Sharif Ssewanyana wipped in a darling cross into the area, Ofoyirwoth latched on to the ball before he set up Kyomuhendo at the far post. With seven to play, Gagganga thought he had extended UCU’s lead but the centre referee cancelled it after citing an infringement. A minute into the second stanza, Kyomuhendo doubled the lead to give the hosts great momentum going forward. In the 51st minute, Joel Okiria pulled back one from the spot after the centre referee awarded Busitema a penalty. Two minutes past the hour mark, UCU stretched their lead to three after Gagganga nodded home Ssewanyana’s corner kick. Four minutes later, Gagganga completed a personal brace with a screamer past Busitema goalkeeper Mahad Anyole. In the 74th minute, Gagganga made it five with another venomous shot adding salt to Busitema’s wounds. It became a goal gallery as Ofoyrwoth slotted the ball home after Opio’s phenomenal delivery. It was a point of madness in the backline after Aapa failed to clear the ball, Kyomuhendo won possession and fired it home. The victory took the Cardinals to six points in two games played sofar. The next match will see MUBS host IUIU at Nakawa on Wednesday, October 4, 2023.

newsArray.content: Match of the Day: Incorrect VAR decision rules out Luis Diaz goal against Tottenham The audio recordings of discussions between the match officials around Luis Diaz's disallowed goal against Tottenham have been made public. Liverpool asked the Premier League for the audio after the controversy in the first half of their 2-1 defeat. Video assistant referee Darren England did not overrule when Liverpool's Diaz was wrongly flagged offside. In the audio, England says the check is "perfect" before swearing when he realises a mistake has been made. Following the incident in Saturday's Premier League game, Liverpool said "sporting integrity has been undermined". In a statement on Sunday, the club said they will "explore the range of options available given the clear need for escalation and resolution". PGMOL, the governing body for referees, has said the decision to disallow the goal was "a significant human error". "In a lapse of concentration and loss of focus in that moment, the VAR lost sight of the on field decision and he incorrectly communicated "check complete", therefore inadvertently confirming the on-field decision," added PGMOL in a statement accompanying the release of the audio on Tuesday. "He did this without any dialogue with the Assistant VAR (AVAR). The match then restarted immediately. "After a few seconds, the Replay Operator and then the AVAR queried the check-complete outcome with the VAR and asked him to review the image that had been created, pointing out that the original on-field decision had been offside, but this was not communicated to the on-field team at any point during the match. "The VAR team then gave consideration as to whether the game could be stopped at that point. "However, the VAR and AVAR concluded that the VAR protocol within the Laws of the Game would not permit that to happen, and they decided intervention was not possible as play had restarted." newsArray.content: Former FC Barcelona, Manchester United, and AC Milan talismanic striker, Zlatan Ibrahimovic has confirmed that he turned down an offer from Arsenal as a youngster. Zlatan Ibrahimovic who retired from football earlier this year after an illustrious football career that saw him score a total of 405 League goals for the 9 different clubs he has played for said coach Arsene Wenger invited him to Arsenal but he turned down the invitation. Ibrahimovic who stated this in an interview with Piers Morgan which will be released on Thursday, October 5, said he had to turn down the invitation then because the former Arsenal’s coach was inviting him for a trial. The 42-year-old Swedish football icon stressed that he was too good to go for trials which was why he turned down the offer even though he was just a 17-year-old then. “Wenger invited me but I didn’t go to Arsenal. I don’t do trials”, he said. “No no, you don’t understand… I don’t do trials. I am the best; f**k the rest”. After turning down an opportunity to play for Arsenal, Zlatan Ibrahimovic went on to join Dutch club Ajax in 2001 where he won two Eredivisie, one KNVB Cup, and one Johan Cruyff Shield. From there, he joined Juventus in 2004, Inter Milan in 2006, and FC Barcelona in 2009. While at FC Barcelona, before he went on loan at AC Milan in 2010, he was coached by Pep Guardiola who was just venturing into professional coaching then. In his interview with Piers Morgan, Zlatan Ibrahimovic revealed that one of the rules of Pep Guardiola at Barcelona was that none of his players must drive a luxurious car like a Ferrari to training. Immediately the coach told him that, he brought a Ferrari to training. The Swedish icon said, “When I first met Pep Guardiola, he told me: remember, players here don’t come with Ferraris”. “What did I do? Of course. I brought my f**** Ferrari”.

newsArray.title: Heisman Watch: USC’s Caleb Williams would join select company even if he finishes second
creator: Jon Wilner
newsArray.description: The reigning Heisman Trophy winner would join select company if he repeats the accomplishment or finishes second.
newsArray.content: Caleb Williams is chasing Heisman Trophy history on more than one level. The USC quarterback is attempting to join Ohio State running back Archie Griffin as the only repeat winners. But the list of Heisman honorees who finished second the following year is equally short. It includes Oklahoma running back Billy Sims, who won the Heisman in 1978 and was runner-up to USC’s Charles White in 1979, and nobody else. Even a third-place finish the succeeding year is a high bar for the winners, with just six players accomplishing that feat: SMU running back Doak Walker, BYU quarterback Ty Detmer, Oklahoma quarterback Jason White, USC quarterback Matt Leinart, Florida quarterback Tim Tebow and Louisville quarterback Lamar Jackson. Williams has all the ingredients necessary to return to New York City as a finalist, from the brand power of his school to the video-game statistics he produces each week to the big-stage showdowns looming in the heart of the season. But like so many other winners, Williams is competing against himself — against the standard he set last year and the hype he generated throughout the offseason. Also, he’s competing against USC’s rickety defense, which stands to cost the Trojans a game or two (or three). And if the Trojans are out of the playoff hunt in the stretch run, Williams’ candidacy could suffer. Welcome to our weekly look at the Pac-12’s leading Heisman Trophy candidates via an assessment of the top players in the conference. Consider this one Heisman voter’s view of the landscape. The rankings below are based on individual performance, value to the team and quality of competition. Arizona State WR Elijhah Badger, USC AP Zachariah Branch, Oregon WR Troy Franklin and Colorado WR/CB Travis Hunter. 1. Washington QB Michael Penix Jr. 1 399.8 yards per game, 11.2 yards per attempt, 16 touchdowns Penix’s standard of excellence is so high that throwing for 363 yards in a road win (at Arizona) felt like a subpar performance. He has the platform to potentially take control of the race in two weeks when the Huskies host Oregon. 2. USC QB Caleb Williams 4 217.7 passer rating, 11.4 yards per attempt, 21 touchdowns After Penix duels with Oregon’s Bo Nix on the afternoon of Oct. 14, Williams will take center stage on hallowed ground. USC’s primetime showdown with Notre Dame will determine whether Williams enters the second half of the season as the frontrunner or a contender. 3. Oregon QB Bo Nix 2 184.7 passer rating, 80.4 completion percentage, 15 touchdowns Nix completed 27-of-32 passes for 290 yards and four touchdowns in the victory at Stanford and dropped a spot in our rankings. Such is life in the Pac-12 this season. His chances to ascend are coming, in unrelenting fashion. 4. Washington State QB Cam Ward 3 347.3 yards per game, 74.5 completion percentage, zero interceptions The most recent Heisman odds from BetMGM list 11 players ahead of Ward. Keep everything about his season the same and change the name on his uniform to USC or Texas, and he would be in the lead pack alongside Penix, Williams and Nix. 5. Colorado QB Shedeur Sanders 5 356.2 yards per game, 74.8 completion percentage, 15 touchdowns Sanders was marvelous in the second half against USC and finished with numbers that suggest he should remain on the top tier. But victories are essential to sustained Heisman campaigns. A few more losses, and Sanders’ prospects will plunge. 6. Washington WR Rome Odunze 6 19 yards per catch, 4 touchdowns, 141.8 all-purpose yards per game The best offensive player in the conference who doesn’t play quarterback had a modest evening in the desert with five catches for 64 yards. The margin for receivers is thin. Odunze needs a big game against the Ducks. Related Articles 7. Utah DE Jonah Elliss 7 10.5 tackles-for-loss, 7.5 sacks If the season ended today, Elliss would be our pick for Pac-12 Defensive Player of the Year. The son of former Utah star Luther Elliss leads the country in sacks and is second in tackles-for-loss. At his current rate, he will be a finalist for numerous national defensive awards. 8. Oregon State TB Damien Martinez 10 99.4 yards per game, 6.8 yards per carry The Pac-12’s best tailback managed just 65 yards against Utah’s granite defense but remains on pace for all-conference honors and a 1,000-yard season. As Martinez goes, so go the Beavers — and they hope to go all the way to the conference championship. 9. Cal TB Jaydn Ott Not ranked 117.8 yards per game, 5 touchdowns Ott carved up Arizona State for 165 yards last weekend and is one of the top off-the-radar playmakers in the conference. Cal simply doesn’t participate in enough high-profile games for Ott to gain recognition outside the conference footprint. 10. Washington State Edge Ron Stone Jr. 9 20 tackles, 4 tackles-for-loss, 2 fumbles forced Stone lost early-season momentum due to a drop in production and WSU’s bye. But a major opportunity awaits this week against UCLA’s wobbly offensive line, which surrendered seven sacks to Utah.

newsArray.content: Главный тренер «Зенита» Сергей Семак прокомментировал дебют голкипера Дениса Адамова. — Родригао вернулся в основной состав. Его возвращение означает, что вы можете переключиться обратно с тройки центральных защитников на двойку или это несвязанные вещи? — Конечно, мы можем, учитывая то количество повреждений, которое было... Еще месяц назад у нас четыре центральных защитника были травмированы. Конечно, он набирает форму. Мы будем смотреть как Марио, как Слава Караваев. Посмотрим на наличие тех или иных игроков и будем отталкиваться при выборе схемы и того, как будем играть. Естественно, будем анализировать соперника и если нужны будут какие-то изменения, будем их вносить — Официально дебютировал Денис Адамов... — У нас в чемпионате играл Миша, получил травму. Сыграл Саша. У нас есть Адамов, которому мы хотели дать игровою практику. Сегодня такая возможность предоставилась, такая же ситуация и на других позициях. Мы по возможности даем играть тем, кто меньше играет в чемпионате. — В перерыве вы сделали тройную замену. Можете рассказать, она запланирована? Или вы недовольны были Ренаном, Коваленко и Изидором? — Думаю, конечно, и Саше, и Изидору не всегда понятно как играть в той или иной ситуации, а игроки, которые у нас дольше времени играют, они больше требования понимают. Что касается Алипа и Ренана, чтобы выпустить игрока, нужен был еще один русский. Потому что у нас в стартовом составе вышли три россиянина — Ваня Сергеев, Саша Коваленко и Денис Адамов. Чтобы поменять Коваленко, нужно было выпустить русского игрока. Дали возможность и Алипу 45 минут сыграть, и Ренану, чтобы все были в тонусе. По поводу Кассьерры, конечно, запланировано, потому что он пропустил из-за микроповреждения. Ему нужно набирать форму и возвращаться в тот ритм, который у него был. По поводу Коваленко и Барриоса —и Барриос нужен, он уже соскучился по Кубку, очень долго не играл. И мы, тем самым, дали ему хорошую возможность быть в тонусе. — Вы сказали, что замена Ренана была связана с лимитом. Но может быть вы видели, выступил его агент, который сказал, что Ренан — не игрок скамейки, что он должен играть. Как-то вы отреагировали на это и что думаете по поводу этих слов? Какие шансы у Ренана вернуться в основной состав полноценно? — Думаю, у Роберта такие же шансы, как и у других игроков вернуться. Для того, чтобы играть в стартовом составе, нужно заслужить и быть лучше. Есть определенная конкуренция. А по поводу слов — зачем что-то комментировать? Я смотрю на то, как ребята выглядят. Ренан очень молодой игрок, естественно ему нужно прибавлять. К сожалению, иногда он достаточно часто ошибается, что свойственно молодежи, и нужно потихоньку его выводить тот уровень, когда он пришел. Эмоционально он был на подъеме. А что касается именно оборонительных действий, он не всегда надежно играет , — сказал Семак на пресс-конференции. «Зенит» (11 очков) вышел на первое место в группе C, обойдя «Балтику» (9 очков). В заключительном туре сине-бело-голубые 31 октября дома сыграют с «Крыльями Советов».

newsArray.content: Uganda Christian University (UCU) registered a 7-1 victory against Busitema University in the University Football League on Tuesday in Mukono. It was a sounding victory to make a statement as UCU ran riot over the Busia based side. Six minutes into the game, the hosts got their first cut through Geoffrey Gagganga but Busitema’s defender Jonathan Aapa made a great interception. UCU skipper Geofrey Gaganga released Isaac Ofoyrwoth on the left flank but failed to go but the lanky defender. Peter Kyomuhendo gave UCU the lead through a tap-in to light up the party at home. Sharif Ssewanyana wipped in a darling cross into the area, Ofoyirwoth latched on to the ball before he set up Kyomuhendo at the far post. With seven to play, Gagganga thought he had extended UCU’s lead but the centre referee cancelled it after citing an infringement. A minute into the second stanza, Kyomuhendo doubled the lead to give the hosts great momentum going forward. In the 51st minute, Joel Okiria pulled back one from the spot after the centre referee awarded Busitema a penalty. Two minutes past the hour mark, UCU stretched their lead to three after Gagganga nodded home Ssewanyana’s corner kick. Four minutes later, Gagganga completed a personal brace with a screamer past Busitema goalkeeper Mahad Anyole. In the 74th minute, Gagganga made it five with another venomous shot adding salt to Busitema’s wounds. It became a goal gallery as Ofoyrwoth slotted the ball home after Opio’s phenomenal delivery. It was a point of madness in the backline after Aapa failed to clear the ball, Kyomuhendo won possession and fired it home. The victory took the Cardinals to six points in two games played sofar. The next match will see MUBS host IUIU at Nakawa on Wednesday, October 4, 2023.

newsArray.title: Kickoff | Chiefs to feel the pain of another trophy miss
newsArray.description: Kaizer Chiefs will again feel the effects of their frustrating trophy drought this weekend with Orlando Pirates having an opportunity to further close the gap while Mamelodi Sundowns will widen their gap of dominance.
newsArray.content: The latest edition of the MTN8 pits Orlando Pirates against Mamelodi Sundowns. Pirates are aiming to defend the trophy that they won under 12 months ago at the same venue while Sundowns will be out to also wrestle back the title that they also won the previous year (2021). The Bucs and The Brazilians have never met in a final of this competition since MTN took over sponsorship in 2008 with the last time they played in the decider having been when SAA was still the financial backer in 2007. Sundowns won 1-0 on that occasion 16 years ago and considering their dominance of domestic football through the last decade and recent results will be the favourites on Saturday. Should Rulani Mokwena lift the trophy on Saturday it will push Sundowns’ trophy tally in the PSL era years up to 26. It will also mean the Chloorkop based club has now won 16 trophies since Chiefs last tasted silverware eight years ago. Chiefs remain stuck on 20. For Pirates, MTN8 success will bring them ever closer to AmaKhosi. After lifting the MTN8 and Nedbank Cup last season, Pirates have now moved to 15 titles. Of note is the fact that when Chiefs landed trophy number 20 of the PSL era years in 2015, Sundowns only had half of that loot but have now gone on to surpass AmaKhosi and create a gap of five within eight years.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic who retired from football earlier this year after an illustrious football career that saw him score a total of 405 League goals for the 9 different clubs he […] The post Zlatan Ibrahimovic Reveals Why He Snubbed Arsenal, Comments On Guardiola appeared first on Naija News.
newsArray.content: Former FC Barcelona, Manchester United, and AC Milan talismanic striker, Zlatan Ibrahimovic has confirmed that he turned down an offer from Arsenal as a youngster. Zlatan Ibrahimovic who retired from football earlier this year after an illustrious football career that saw him score a total of 405 League goals for the 9 different clubs he has played for said coach Arsene Wenger invited him to Arsenal but he turned down the invitation. Ibrahimovic who stated this in an interview with Piers Morgan which will be released on Thursday, October 5, said he had to turn down the invitation then because the former Arsenal’s coach was inviting him for a trial. The 42-year-old Swedish football icon stressed that he was too good to go for trials which was why he turned down the offer even though he was just a 17-year-old then. “Wenger invited me but I didn’t go to Arsenal. I don’t do trials”, he said. “No no, you don’t understand… I don’t do trials. I am the best; f**k the rest”. After turning down an opportunity to play for Arsenal, Zlatan Ibrahimovic went on to join Dutch club Ajax in 2001 where he won two Eredivisie, one KNVB Cup, and one Johan Cruyff Shield. From there, he joined Juventus in 2004, Inter Milan in 2006, and FC Barcelona in 2009. While at FC Barcelona, before he went on loan at AC Milan in 2010, he was coached by Pep Guardiola who was just venturing into professional coaching then. In his interview with Piers Morgan, Zlatan Ibrahimovic revealed that one of the rules of Pep Guardiola at Barcelona was that none of his players must drive a luxurious car like a Ferrari to training. Immediately the coach told him that, he brought a Ferrari to training. The Swedish icon said, “When I first met Pep Guardiola, he told me: remember, players here don’t come with Ferraris”. “What did I do? Of course. I brought my f**** Ferrari”.

newsArray.title: Heisman Watch: USC’s Caleb Williams would join select company even if he finishes second
creator: Jon Wilner
newsArray.description: The reigning Heisman Trophy winner would join select company if he repeats the accomplishment or finishes second.
newsArray.content: Caleb Williams is chasing Heisman Trophy history on more than one level. The USC quarterback is attempting to join Ohio State running back Archie Griffin as the only repeat winners. But the list of Heisman honorees who finished second the following year is equally short. It includes Oklahoma running back Billy Sims, who won the Heisman in 1978 and was runner-up to USC’s Charles White in 1979, and nobody else. Even a third-place finish the succeeding year is a high bar for the winners, with just six players accomplishing that feat: SMU running back Doak Walker, BYU quarterback Ty Detmer, Oklahoma quarterback Jason White, USC quarterback Matt Leinart, Florida quarterback Tim Tebow and Louisville quarterback Lamar Jackson. Williams has all the ingredients necessary to return to New York City as a finalist, from the brand power of his school to the video-game statistics he produces each week to the big-stage showdowns looming in the heart of the season. But like so many other winners, Williams is competing against himself — against the standard he set last year and the hype he generated throughout the offseason. Also, he’s competing against USC’s rickety defense, which stands to cost the Trojans a game or two (or three). And if the Trojans are out of the playoff hunt in the stretch run, Williams’ candidacy could suffer. Welcome to our weekly look at the Pac-12’s leading Heisman Trophy candidates via an assessment of the top players in the conference. Consider this one Heisman voter’s view of the landscape. The rankings below are based on individual performance, value to the team and quality of competition. Arizona State WR Elijhah Badger, USC AP Zachariah Branch, Oregon WR Troy Franklin and Colorado WR/CB Travis Hunter. 1. Washington QB Michael Penix Jr. 1 399.8 yards per game, 11.2 yards per attempt, 16 touchdowns Penix’s standard of excellence is so high that throwing for 363 yards in a road win (at Arizona) felt like a subpar performance. He has the platform to potentially take control of the race in two weeks when the Huskies host Oregon. 2. USC QB Caleb Williams 4 217.7 passer rating, 11.4 yards per attempt, 21 touchdowns After Penix duels with Oregon’s Bo Nix on the afternoon of Oct. 14, Williams will take center stage on hallowed ground. USC’s primetime showdown with Notre Dame will determine whether Williams enters the second half of the season as the frontrunner or a contender. 3. Oregon QB Bo Nix 2 184.7 passer rating, 80.4 completion percentage, 15 touchdowns Nix completed 27-of-32 passes for 290 yards and four touchdowns in the victory at Stanford and dropped a spot in our rankings. Such is life in the Pac-12 this season. His chances to ascend are coming, in unrelenting fashion. 4. Washington State QB Cam Ward 3 347.3 yards per game, 74.5 completion percentage, zero interceptions The most recent Heisman odds from BetMGM list 11 players ahead of Ward. Keep everything about his season the same and change the name on his uniform to USC or Texas, and he would be in the lead pack alongside Penix, Williams and Nix. 5. Colorado QB Shedeur Sanders 5 356.2 yards per game, 74.8 completion percentage, 15 touchdowns Sanders was marvelous in the second half against USC and finished with numbers that suggest he should remain on the top tier. But victories are essential to sustained Heisman campaigns. A few more losses, and Sanders’ prospects will plunge. 6. Washington WR Rome Odunze 6 19 yards per catch, 4 touchdowns, 141.8 all-purpose yards per game The best offensive player in the conference who doesn’t play quarterback had a modest evening in the desert with five catches for 64 yards. The margin for receivers is thin. Odunze needs a big game against the Ducks. Related Articles 7. Utah DE Jonah Elliss 7 10.5 tackles-for-loss, 7.5 sacks If the season ended today, Elliss would be our pick for Pac-12 Defensive Player of the Year. The son of former Utah star Luther Elliss leads the country in sacks and is second in tackles-for-loss. At his current rate, he will be a finalist for numerous national defensive awards. 8. Oregon State TB Damien Martinez 10 99.4 yards per game, 6.8 yards per carry The Pac-12’s best tailback managed just 65 yards against Utah’s granite defense but remains on pace for all-conference honors and a 1,000-yard season. As Martinez goes, so go the Beavers — and they hope to go all the way to the conference championship. 9. Cal TB Jaydn Ott Not ranked 117.8 yards per game, 5 touchdowns Ott carved up Arizona State for 165 yards last weekend and is one of the top off-the-radar playmakers in the conference. Cal simply doesn’t participate in enough high-profile games for Ott to gain recognition outside the conference footprint. 10. Washington State Edge Ron Stone Jr. 9 20 tackles, 4 tackles-for-loss, 2 fumbles forced Stone lost early-season momentum due to a drop in production and WSU’s bye. But a major opportunity awaits this week against UCLA’s wobbly offensive line, which surrendered seven sacks to Utah.

newsArray.title: Семак высказался о дебюте Адамова за «Зенит»
newsArray.description: Главный тренер «Зенита» Сергей Семак прокомментировал дебют голкипера Дениса Адамова.
newsArray.content: Главный тренер «Зенита» Сергей Семак прокомментировал дебют голкипера Дениса Адамова. — Родригао вернулся в основной состав. Его возвращение означает, что вы можете переключиться обратно с тройки центральных защитников на двойку или это несвязанные вещи? — Конечно, мы можем, учитывая то количество повреждений, которое было... Еще месяц назад у нас четыре центральных защитника были травмированы. Конечно, он набирает форму. Мы будем смотреть как Марио, как Слава Караваев. Посмотрим на наличие тех или иных игроков и будем отталкиваться при выборе схемы и того, как будем играть. Естественно, будем анализировать соперника и если нужны будут какие-то изменения, будем их вносить — Официально дебютировал Денис Адамов... — У нас в чемпионате играл Миша, получил травму. Сыграл Саша. У нас есть Адамов, которому мы хотели дать игровою практику. Сегодня такая возможность предоставилась, такая же ситуация и на других позициях. Мы по возможности даем играть тем, кто меньше играет в чемпионате. — В перерыве вы сделали тройную замену. Можете рассказать, она запланирована? Или вы недовольны были Ренаном, Коваленко и Изидором? — Думаю, конечно, и Саше, и Изидору не всегда понятно как играть в той или иной ситуации, а игроки, которые у нас дольше времени играют, они больше требования понимают. Что касается Алипа и Ренана, чтобы выпустить игрока, нужен был еще один русский. Потому что у нас в стартовом составе вышли три россиянина — Ваня Сергеев, Саша Коваленко и Денис Адамов. Чтобы поменять Коваленко, нужно было выпустить русского игрока. Дали возможность и Алипу 45 минут сыграть, и Ренану, чтобы все были в тонусе. По поводу Кассьерры, конечно, запланировано, потому что он пропустил из-за микроповреждения. Ему нужно набирать форму и возвращаться в тот ритм, который у него был. По поводу Коваленко и Барриоса —и Барриос нужен, он уже соскучился по Кубку, очень долго не играл. И мы, тем самым, дали ему хорошую возможность быть в тонусе. — Вы сказали, что замена Ренана была связана с лимитом. Но может быть вы видели, выступил его агент, который сказал, что Ренан — не игрок скамейки, что он должен играть. Как-то вы отреагировали на это и что думаете по поводу этих слов? Какие шансы у Ренана вернуться в основной состав полноценно? — Думаю, у Роберта такие же шансы, как и у других игроков вернуться. Для того, чтобы играть в стартовом составе, нужно заслужить и быть лучше. Есть определенная конкуренция. А по поводу слов — зачем что-то комментировать? Я смотрю на то, как ребята выглядят. Ренан очень молодой игрок, естественно ему нужно прибавлять. К сожалению, иногда он достаточно часто ошибается, что свойственно молодежи, и нужно потихоньку его выводить тот уровень, когда он пришел. Эмоционально он был на подъеме. А что касается именно оборонительных действий, он не всегда надежно играет , — сказал Семак на пресс-конференции. «Зенит» (11 очков) вышел на первое место в группе C, обойдя «Балтику» (9 очков). В заключительном туре сине-бело-голубые 31 октября дома сыграют с «Крыльями Советов».

newsArray.content: Uganda Christian University (UCU) registered a 7-1 victory against Busitema University in the University Football League on Tuesday in Mukono. It was a sounding victory to make a statement as UCU ran riot over the Busia based side. Six minutes into the game, the hosts got their first cut through Geoffrey Gagganga but Busitema’s defender Jonathan Aapa made a great interception. UCU skipper Geofrey Gaganga released Isaac Ofoyrwoth on the left flank but failed to go but the lanky defender. Peter Kyomuhendo gave UCU the lead through a tap-in to light up the party at home. Sharif Ssewanyana wipped in a darling cross into the area, Ofoyirwoth latched on to the ball before he set up Kyomuhendo at the far post. With seven to play, Gagganga thought he had extended UCU’s lead but the centre referee cancelled it after citing an infringement. A minute into the second stanza, Kyomuhendo doubled the lead to give the hosts great momentum going forward. In the 51st minute, Joel Okiria pulled back one from the spot after the centre referee awarded Busitema a penalty. Two minutes past the hour mark, UCU stretched their lead to three after Gagganga nodded home Ssewanyana’s corner kick. Four minutes later, Gagganga completed a personal brace with a screamer past Busitema goalkeeper Mahad Anyole. In the 74th minute, Gagganga made it five with another venomous shot adding salt to Busitema’s wounds. It became a goal gallery as Ofoyrwoth slotted the ball home after Opio’s phenomenal delivery. It was a point of madness in the backline after Aapa failed to clear the ball, Kyomuhendo won possession and fired it home. The victory took the Cardinals to six points in two games played sofar. The next match will see MUBS host IUIU at Nakawa on Wednesday, October 4, 2023.
